sub_title: Science specialist and team lead at Aramco Overseas Company
summary: Diego Rovetta is a senior research geophysicist who has been working for Aramco on multi-geophysics integration and joint inversion since 2011. He is currently leading the HPC for Reservoir Technologies focus area at the Aramco global research center in Delft. He previously worked as a researcher for Politecnico di Milano, collaborating with different companies (eni, Saipem, Schlumberger, etc.), and as a geophysicist at the WesternGeco Center of Excellence for electromagnetics. In 2002, he received his MSc. degree in Telecommunications Engineering from Politecnico di Milano, studying non-linear inverse problem applications using Simulated Annealing. In 2006, he obtained his Ph.D. from the same institute in Information Engineering focusing on geophysical inverse problems. Diego founded the EAGE local chapter in the Netherlands that he chaired between 2019 and 2022.

awards.title: 2023 EAGE Best Local Chapter Award
awards.description: During my chairmanship EAGE Local Chapter Netherlands received the 2023 EAGE Best Local Chapter award
awards.issuer: European Association of Geoscientists and Engineers

awards.title: 2022 Saudi Aramco EXPEC-ARC Volunteer of the Year Award
awards.description: Diego Rovetta founded in 2019 the local chapter of the European Association of Geoscientists and Engineers (EAGE) in The Netherlands and he has been its president since then and until December 2022. During his mandate Diego was able to gather more than 100 local professionals and more than 200 followers, organizing more than 40 technical talks on topics going from traditional Oil & gas and near-surface geoscience to recent advances in energy transition, AI, HPC and quantum computing. As a recognition of the excellent results the local chapter Netherlands was awarded by EAGE as "Best Local Chapter Newcomer" in 2021. Diego’s exceptional contribution to the geoscience community in The Netherlands also positively reflected on the company image in terms of high professionalism and commitment to share geoscientific knowledge locally and globally.

awards.title: 2018 Saudi Aramco Excellence Award
awards.description: The multi-physics focus area of geophysical technology division of EXPEC Advanced Research Center invented a number of disruptive technologies for near-surface that dramatically impacted and benefited operations within Saudi Aramco and throughout the industry.

awards.title: 2017 ICEG Innovation Award for Geophysics
awards.description: Refraction-based surface-consistent amplitude compensation and deconvolution - aQC technology
awards.issuer: SEG - International Conference on Engineering Geophysics

awards.title: 2017 E&P Special Meritorious Award for Engineering Innovation for Exploration
awards.description: Seismic and EM Joint Inversion for Accurate Depth Images technology has been awarded with 2017 E&P Special Meritorious Award for Engineering Innovation for Exploration.

awards.title: Honorable Mention for best paper in the Leading Edge for 2016.
awards.description: The paper entitled, "High-resolution velocity modeling by seismic-airborne TEM joint inversion for near-surface velocity characterization", describes an industry-first application of seismic-airborne electromagnetic joint inversion technology for near-surface velocity characterization. It has been awarded with Honorable Mention for best paper in the Leading Edge for 2016.

awards.title: Best Exhibit Award at IST-2006
awards.description: Co-author and developer of a TAI-CHI, Tangible Acoustic Interfaces for Computer-Human Interaction, prototype, winning the "Best Exhibit Award" at the IST-2006 European technology fair (Helsinki, Finland)

awards.title: SAIPEM technology development competition
awards.description: Co-author and developer of the EAR, Extended Acoustic Radar, pipeline monitoring system, winning a SAIPEM technology development competition
